articles.headline: In Germany, a Limp Domestic Economy Stifled by Regulation
articles.snippet: Alongside Germany’s export success is another, creakier economy that suffers from overregulation and holds back not only the country but the rest of Europe, some economists say.
articles.abstract: Alongside Germany’s export success is another, creakier economy that suffers from overregulation and holds back not only the country but the rest of Europe, some economists say.
articles.lead_paragraph: FRANKFURT — Torsten Emmel may have looked like an innocent florist, a gentle guy with a shaved head and an apron, clipping the stems of fresh freesia. In fact, he was on the verge of breaking the law.

articles.headline: Shift in Virginia on Abortion Bill
articles.snippet: Gov. Bob McDonnell said he wanted an amendment stipulating that pre-abortion ultrasounds be limited to a non-invasive abdominal scan.
articles.abstract: Gov. Bob McDonnell said he wanted an amendment stipulating that pre-abortion ultrasounds be limited to a non-invasive abdominal scan.
articles.lead_paragraph: Gov. Bob McDonnell of Virginia backed down on Wednesday on a bill requiring women to have a vaginal ultrasound before undergoing an abortion. It was a sudden change of position for a conservative governor who is viewed as having political ambitions on the national stage.

articles.headline: Advisory Panel Favors Approval for Weight-Loss Drug
articles.snippet: A committee recommended that the Food and Drug Administration approve what could become the first new prescription drug to treat obesity in 13 years.
articles.abstract: A committee recommended that the Food and Drug Administration approve what could become the first new prescription drug to treat obesity in 13 years.
articles.lead_paragraph: A federal advisory panel on Wednesday overwhelmingly recommended approval of what could become the first new prescription drug to treat obesity in 13 years.

articles.headline: Windows on the iPad, and Speedy
articles.snippet: The fastest high-speed Internet service is courtesy of OnLive Desktop Plus. The “plus” is a 1-gigabit-a-second Net connection with the ability to view Flash videos on your iPad.
articles.abstract: The fastest high-speed Internet service is courtesy of OnLive Desktop Plus. The “plus” is a 1-gigabit-a-second Net connection with the ability to view Flash videos on your iPad.
articles.lead_paragraph: You’re probably paying something like $60 a month for high-speed Internet. I’m paying $5 a month more, and my connection is 1,000 times faster.

articles.headline: Behind the Google Goggles, Virtual Reality
articles.snippet: Google will start selling eyeglasses that will project information, entertainment and ads onto the lenses, but questions have been raised on how privacy will be regulated.
articles.abstract: Google will start selling eyeglasses that will project information, entertainment and ads onto the lenses, but questions have been raised on how privacy will be regulated.
articles.lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO — It wasn’t so long ago that legions of people began walking the streets, talking to themselves.

articles.headline: Ghastly Images Flow From Shattered Syrian City
articles.snippet: During the sustained Syrian Army assault on Homs, videos of the violence are offering a stunningly vivid picture, sometimes live or at least in real time, of life in the city.
articles.abstract: During the sustained Syrian Army assault on Homs, videos of the violence are offering a stunningly vivid picture, sometimes live or at least in real time, of life in the city.
articles.lead_paragraph: CAIRO — During a terrifying two minutes on Wednesday morning, 11 rockets slammed into a single apartment building in the Baba Amr neighborhood of Homs, the city in Syria that has been besieged by government forces for 19 days.

articles.headline: Romney, Seeking Traction, Duels With Santorum
articles.snippet: Mitt Romney tried to regain his lead in the fight for the Republican presidential nomination, assailing the voting record of Rick Santorum in a fiercely combative exchange.
articles.abstract: Mitt Romney tried to regain his lead in the fight for the Republican presidential nomination, assailing the voting record of Rick Santorum in a fiercely combative exchange.
articles.lead_paragraph: MESA, Ariz. — Mitt Romney challenged Rick Santorum’s credentials as a fiscal conservative in a fiercely combative debate on Wednesday, trying to redefine Mr. Santorum as part of the problem in Washington and regain his footing in the fight for the Republican presidential nomination.
articles.byline: By Jeff Zeleny and Jim Rutenberg

articles.headline: Winners and Losers From a Tax Proposal
articles.snippet: The Obama administration’s proposal to extend tax breaks to manufacturers would result in other companies losing some lucrative tax benefits.
articles.abstract: The Obama administration’s proposal to extend tax breaks to manufacturers would result in other companies losing some lucrative tax benefits.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — The Obama administration, seeking to promote domestic manufacturing without increasing the federal deficit, proposed Wednesday to offset new tax breaks for manufacturers by raising taxes on a wide range of other companies.

articles.headline: White House, Consumers in Mind, Offers Online Privacy Guidelines
articles.snippet: The Obama administration said its suggestions would empower consumers regarding use of their personal data gleaned from Internet searches.
articles.abstract: The Obama administration said its suggestions would empower consumers regarding use of their personal data gleaned from Internet searches.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — The Obama administration on Wednesday outlined a set of online privacy principles that officials said would help consumers control the use of their personal data gleaned from Internet searches.
